sentences.sentence: College students don't want to become educators.
Here's how to change that.Job satisfaction for teachers is at a 50-year low.
They are leaving the profession while fewer and fewer college students are interested in joining the field.

The Opinion writer Jessica Grose argues that Americans have to change the way they pay, train and appreciate teachers ᅳ or millions of children will suffer the consequences.The Times is committed to publishinga diversity of lettersto the editor.
We'd like to hear what you think about this or any of our articles.
And here's our email:letters@nytimes.com.Follow The New York Times Opinion section onFacebook,Twitter (@NYTopinion)andInstagram.This Opinion Short was produced by Jillian Weinberger.
It was edited by Alison Bruzek, Kaari Pitkin and Annie-Rose Strasser.
Original music by Pat McCusker, Efim Shapiro, Carole Sabouraud and Isaac Jones.
Audience strategy by Shannon Busta and Kristina Samulewski.PHOTO: (PHOTOGRAPH BY Illustration by Akshita Chandra/The New York Times; Photograph by Image Source/Getty Images FOR THE NEW YORK TIMES)

documents.result_message: Our detector is highly confident that the text is written entirely by a human.
documents.inputText: College students don’t want to become educators. Here’s how to change that.Job satisfaction for teachers is at a 50-year low. They are leaving the profession while fewer and fewer college students are interested in joining the field. The Opinion writer Jessica Grose argues that Americans have to change the way they pay, train and appreciate teachers — or millions of children will suffer the consequences.The Times is committed to publishinga diversity of lettersto the editor. We’d like to hear what you think about this or any of our articles. Here are sometips. And here’s our email:letters@nytimes.com.Follow The New York Times Opinion section onFacebook,Twitter (@NYTopinion)andInstagram.This Opinion Short was produced by Jillian Weinberger. It was edited by Alison Bruzek, Kaari Pitkin and Annie-Rose Strasser. Mixing by Efim Shapiro. Original music by Pat McCusker, Efim Shapiro, Carole Sabouraud and Isaac Jones. Fact-checking by Mary Marge Locker. Audience strategy by Shannon Busta and Kristina Samulewski.PHOTO:  (PHOTOGRAPH BY Illustration by Akshita Chandra/The New York Times; Photograph by Image Source/Getty Images FOR THE NEW YORK TIMES)
